sources.title: Force of Evil (1948) John Garfield, Beatrice Pearson, Marie Windsor
sources.description: Force of Evil is a 1948 American crime FILM NOlR directed by Abraham Polonsky, who was previously known as a screenwriter for the boxing film Body and Soul (1947). Like Body and Soul, the film starred John Garfield. The film was adapted by Abraham Polonsky and Ira Wolfert from Wolfert's novel Tucker's People    In 1994, Force of Evil was selected for preservation in the United States National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as being "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant".   You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia . There is also a good review of the movie here from the movie blog Senses of Cinema .

sources.title: FORCE OF EVIL (1949)
sources.description: John Garfield is a New York lawyer who becomes involved with the numbers racket. Will Garfield be able to get out before he gets caught? Enjoy this great film-noir classic. From a video source.

metadata.Plot: Lawyer Joe Morse wants to consolidate all the small-time numbers racket operators into one big powerful operation. But his elder brother Leo is one of these small-time operators who wants to stay that way, preferring not to deal with the gangsters who dominate the big-time.
metadata.Actors: John Garfield, Thomas Gomez, Beatrice Pearson
